quickView.definicao: A multifactorial clinical condition characterized by sustained blood pressure levels ≥140/90 mmHg. It is the primary modifiable risk factor for cardiovascular, cerebrovascular, and renal diseases.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Office BP ≥140/90 mmHg on 2 or more separate occasions
24-hour ambulatory BP: mean 24h ≥130/80 mmHg, awake ≥135/85 mmHg, sleep ≥120/70 mmHg
Home BP monitoring: mean ≥130/80 mmHg (7 days, 2 measurements/day)
Rule out white coat hypertension and masked hypertension

naoFarmacologico: Weight loss if BMI >25 (goal: 5-10% weight loss)
Alcohol moderation (≤2 drinks/day for men, ≤1 for women)
farmacologico: ACE inhibitors (Enalapril 5-20mg every 12 hours) or ARBs (Losartan 50-100mg/day)
Preferred combinations: ACE/ARB + CCB or ACE/ARB + Diuretic
Avoid monotherapy in stage 2 or high CV risk

metasTerapeuticas: BP <130/80 mmHg if high CV risk, DM, or CKD
BP <130/80 mmHg in fit elderly (<80 years)
BP <150/90 mmHg in frail elderly (>80 years)
redFlags: BP ≥180/120 mmHg with symptoms (severe headache, visual changes, dyspnea)
Suspected secondary SAH (onset <30 years, refractory, hypokalemia)
Acute target organ damage (MI, stroke, aortic dissection)

epidemiologia.faixaEtaria: Progressively increases with age (>60% in >65 years)

criterios: BP ≥140/90 mmHg in 2+ visits with proper technique
Ambulatory BP or home BP monitoring for confirmation (exclude white coat hypertension)
examesLaboratoriais: Fasting glucose, HbA1c, creatinine, potassium, uric acid
outrosExames: Renal ultrasound if suspected secondary SAH

medidas: DASH diet: rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, low-fat dairy

primeiraLinha.observacoes: Dry cough in 5-20%. CI: pregnancy, K>5.5, bilateral renal stenosis

segundaLinha.observacoes: Prefer in HF, AF, post-MI. Avoid in decompensated COPD

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: ACEI or ARB if albuminuria. Target <130/80
Methyldopa, Nifedipine, Labetalol. CI: ACEI, ARB
CCB or thiazide as first line (better response)

tratamento.duracao: Continuous treatment. Discontinuation only in selected cases (successful MEV, mild initial SAH)

examesControle: Creatinine and K+ (1-2 weeks after starting/adjusting ACEI/ARB/diuretic)
Microalbuminuria: annually if DM or CKD
metasTerapeuticas: BP <130/80 mmHg if high risk, DM, CKD
criteriosEncaminhamento: Resistant SAH (uncontrolled with 3 drugs including diuretic)

quickView.definicao: Clinical syndrome characterized by the heart's inability to pump sufficient blood to meet the metabolic needs of tissues, or to do so only with elevated filling pressures.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Typical symptoms: dyspnea, orthopnea, PND, fatigue, edema of lower extremities
Signs: jugular venous distension, hepatomegaly, pulmonary crackles
Objective evidence of cardiac dysfunction (echocardiogram)
Framingham criteria: 2 major OR 1 major + 2 minor

farmacologico: ACE inhibitor or ARB (e.g., Enalapril 2.5-20mg every 12 hours)

metasTerapeuticas: NYHA functional class: improvement of at least 1 class
examesIniciais: Complete blood count, renal function, electrolytes

epidemiologia.prevalencia: 2% of the adult population, increases with age (>10% in >70 years)

fisiopatologia.texto: Systolic dysfunction (reduced LVEF) or diastolic dysfunction (preserved LVEF) leads to compensatory neurohormonal activation (RAAS, sympathetic system), progressive cardiac remodeling, and systemic/pulmonary congestion.

criterios: Echocardiogram with LVEF and diastolic function
examesLaboratoriais: Complete blood count, renal function, electrolytes

objetivos: Relieve symptoms and improve quality of life

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Rate control with beta-blocker or digoxin

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Monthly until stabilization, then every 3-6 months
examesControle: Renal function and electrolytes (1-2 weeks after ACE inhibitor/diuretic adjustment)
Annual echocardiogram or if clinical worsening

quickView.definicao: Supraventricular arrhythmia characterized by disorganized, irregular, and rapid atrial activation, with loss of effective atrial contraction. It is the most common sustained arrhythmia.
criteriosDiagnosticos: ECG: absence of P waves, presence of irregular f waves
RR intervals irregularly irregular
Atrial rate 350-600 bpm
May be paroxysmal, persistent, or permanent
metasTerapeuticas: Adequate anticoagulation (INR 2-3 or adherence to DOAC)
Prevention of stroke and thromboembolic events
redFlags: AF with RVR and hemodynamic instability

epidemiologia.prevalencia: 2-4% of the adult population, increases with age

fisiopatologia.texto: Multiple reentry circuits in the atria, often initiated by ectopic foci in the pulmonary veins. Atrial electrical and structural remodeling perpetuates the arrhythmia. Atrial stasis predisposes to thrombus formation, mainly in the left atrial appendage.

sinaisExameFisico: Variation in the intensity of S1
Absence of a wave in the jugular pulse
formasClinicas: Permanent: accepted, without attempts to restore rhythm

criterios: F waves of fibrillation (best seen in V1)

primeiraLinha.posologia: Warfarin (INR 2-3) or DOAC according to renal function

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: AVOID digoxin, CCB, beta-blocker. Refer urgently.

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Every 3-6 months, or more frequently if unstable

quickView.definicao: Atherosclerotic obstruction of the coronary arteries leading to myocardial ischemia during exertion or stress. It is characterized by typical predictable angina, stable in frequency and intensity.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Typical chest pain: retrosternal, constricting, triggered by exertion/stress
Relief with rest or sublingual nitrate (1-3 min)
Duration of 2-10 minutes
Positive exercise test or functional imaging with ischemia
metasTerapeuticas: LDL-C <50 mg/dL (very high risk) or <70 mg/dL (high risk)
redFlags: Angina at rest or prolonged (>20 min)

epidemiologia.faixaEtaria: Increases with age, men >45 years, women >55 years

fisiopatologia.texto: Coronary atherosclerosis with plaque formation that reduces the arterial lumen. When the obstruction exceeds 70%, coronary flow becomes insufficient during exertion, causing ischemia and angina.

sintomasPrincipais: Radiation to left shoulder, jaw, back
Triggered by physical exertion, emotional stress, cold
Relieved by rest (1-5 min) or sublingual nitrate
sinaisExameFisico: Transient mitral regurgitation murmur during crisis
formasClinicas: Typical angina: 3 characteristics (typical location, triggered by exertion, relieved by rest/nitrate)

criterios: Or significant coronary anatomy stenosis (>50% TCE or >70% others)

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Calcium channel blocker (Amlodipine, Diltiazem) or Ivabradine
Consider SGLT2 inhibitors or GLP-1 receptor agonists with CV benefit

metasTerapeuticas: No angina or controlled angina (CCS I)
criteriosEncaminhamento: Functional test with large ischemic area

primaria: Strict control of cardiovascular risk factors

quickView.definicao: Decrease in systolic BP ≥20mmHg or diastolic BP ≥10mmHg upon standing. Prevalence 20-30% in >65 years. An important cause of falls.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Decrease in BP upon standing (1-3 min)
Symptoms: dizziness, visual darkening
Reproducible on positional testing
Evaluate causative medications

naoFarmacologico: Increase salt intake (if no severe hypertension)

quickView.definicao: Infection of the endocardium/heart valves. Can be acute (S. aureus) or subacute (streptococci).
criteriosDiagnosticos: Fever
New or changed heart murmur
Positive blood cultures
Echocardiographic vegetations
Duke criteria

farmacologico: Parenteral antibiotic therapy according to blood cultures

quickView.definicao: Ventricular dilation with systolic dysfunction. Reduced ejection fraction.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Heart failure with reduced ejection fraction
Ventricular dilation
Echocardiogram: EF <40%

farmacologico: ACE inhibitor or ARB: Enalapril or Losartan

quickView.definicao: Atherosclerosis of peripheral arteries (especially lower extremities) causing ischemia. ABI <0.9 is diagnostic. Marker of systemic atherosclerotic disease.
criteriosDiagnosticos: ABI (Ankle-Brachial Index) <0.9
Intermittent claudication: pain in calf while walking, relieved by rest
Diminished/absent peripheral pulses
ABI <0.4 or rest pain: critical ischemia

farmacologico: ACE inhibitor if hypertension or diabetes mellitus

quickView.definicao: Obstruction to left ventricular ejection by the aortic valve. Degenerative (calcified) is the most common cause in the elderly. Bicuspid in young individuals.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Systolic ejection murmur at the aortic focus, radiating to the carotids
Echocardiography: Severe AS = valve area <1.0 cm², mean gradient >40 mmHg, Vmax >4 m/s
Symptoms: dyspnea, angina, syncope
Pulse parvus et tardus (delayed and low amplitude)

farmacologico: Limited medical treatment - surgery is definitive

quickView.definicao: Reflux of blood from the left ventricle to the left atrium during systole. Primary (valvular) or secondary (functional due to left ventricular dilation).
criteriosDiagnosticos: Holosystolic murmur at the mitral focus, radiating to the axilla
Echocardiography: severity by regurgitant volume, jet area, vena contracta
Severe mitral regurgitation: LVEF ↓, left ventricular/atrial dilation, pulmonary hypertension

naoFarmacologico: Sodium and fluid restriction if HF
farmacologico: Secondary MR: optimize HF treatment (ACEI/ARB, beta-blocker, spironolactone)

quickView.definicao: Formation of a thrombus in deep veins, usually in the lower limbs. Risk of pulmonary embolism and post-thrombotic syndrome.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Wells score for DVT (clinical probability)
D-dimer: high NPV if low probability
Venous Doppler ultrasound: definitive diagnosis
Unilateral edema, calf pain, induration

farmacologico: DOACs: Rivaroxaban 15mg twice daily for 21 days, then 20mg daily
Or Apixaban 10mg twice daily for 7 days, then 5mg twice daily

quickView.definicao: Obstruction of pulmonary arteries by thrombi, usually originating from deep vein thrombosis of the lower limbs. Spectrum from asymptomatic to hemodynamic instability.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Wells score for PE: high (>6), moderate (2-6), low (<2)
PERC rule: if all negative and low probability, excluded
D-dimer: high NPV if low/moderate probability
Chest CT angiography: gold standard
Sudden dyspnea, pleuritic chest pain, tachycardia, hypoxemia

quickView.definicao: Inflammation of the pericardium, usually idiopathic/viral. Diagnosis: ≥2 of 4 criteria.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Typical chest pain: precordial, worsens with breathing/supine position, improves when sitting
Pericardial friction rub
ECG changes: diffuse ST elevation, PR depression
New or increased pericardial effusion

farmacologico: Aspirin 650-1000mg every 8 hours for 1-2 weeks OR
Colchicine 0.5mg every 12 hours for 3 months (reduces recurrence)

quickView.definicao: Unexplained ventricular hypertrophy (≥15mm), usually asymmetric. Genetic cause (sarcomeric mutations). Leading cause of sudden death in young athletes.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Echocardiogram: IVS thickness ≥15mm without cause
Dynamic LVOT obstruction (gradient ≥30 mmHg)
Systolic anterior motion of the mitral valve (SAM)
ECG: ventricular hypertrophy, Q waves, ST-T changes

farmacologico: ICD if high risk of sudden death

quickView.definicao: Transient loss of consciousness due to global cerebral hypoperfusion with spontaneous and complete recovery. Vasovagal is the most common cause.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Transient loss of consciousness with spontaneous recovery
Reflex syncope (vasovagal): trigger, prodromes (nausea, sweating, blurred vision)
Orthostatic hypotension: BP drop ≥20/10 mmHg upon standing
Cardiac: exercise, palpitations, abnormal ECG, structural heart disease

naoFarmacologico: Vasovagal: avoid triggers, recognize prodromes, perform counterpressure maneuvers
Orthostatic: hydration, salt, rise slowly, compression stockings
farmacologico: Vasovagal: generally non-pharmacological. Fludrocortisone, midodrine if refractory
Orthostatic: fludrocortisone 0.1-0.3mg/day, midodrine 2.5-10mg three times daily
Cardiac: treat the cause (pacemaker, ICD, antiarrhythmic)

quickView.definicao: Chest pain triggered by exertion or emotional stress, relieved by rest or nitrate. Indicates obstructive coronary artery disease.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Retrosternal pain, feeling of squeezing/pressure
Triggered by exertion/stress
Relieved in <10 min with rest or nitrate
Typical angina: 3/3 criteria. Atypical: 2/3

farmacologico: Add a calcium channel blocker if symptoms persist

quickView.definicao: Atrial tachyarrhythmia with macroreentrant circuit. Typical ECG: F waves in sawtooth pattern, atrial HR ~300 bpm, AV conduction usually 2:1 (HR ~150 bpm).
criteriosDiagnosticos: ECG: F waves (sawtooth pattern) in DII, DIII, aVF
Atrial frequency 250-350 bpm
AV conduction 2:1, 3:1, 4:1, or variable
Regular ventricular HR (except if conduction is variable)

farmacologico: Rate control: beta-blocker or non-dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker
Anticoagulation: same rules as for AF (CHA2DS2-VASc)
Pharmacological cardioversion less effective than in AF

metasTerapeuticas: Restore sinus rhythm or control HR

quickView.definicao: Conduction disorder between atria and ventricles. 1st degree: prolonged PR. 2nd degree: some P waves blocked. 3rd degree (complete AV block): complete AV dissociation.
criteriosDiagnosticos: 1st degree AVB: PR >200ms, all P waves conducted
2nd degree AVB Mobitz I: progressively longer PR until P wave is blocked (Wenckebach)
2nd degree AVB Mobitz II: P wave blocked without prior PR prolongation
3rd degree AVB (complete AV block): no P waves conducted, ventricular escape

naoFarmacologico: 1st degree and Mobitz I: observation, remove bradycardic drugs
Complete AV block and Mobitz II: temporary pacemaker → permanent pacemaker
farmacologico: Atropine 0.5-1mg IV (emergency, symptomatic complete AV block)
Discontinue drugs: beta-blocker, calcium channel blocker, digoxin, amiodarone
Treat underlying cause: ischemia, Lyme, hyperkalemia

quickView.definicao: Mean pulmonary artery pressure ≥25 mmHg at rest. Classification: Group 1 (PAH), 2 (left heart disease), 3 (pulmonary), 4 (CTEPH), 5 (multifactorial).
criteriosDiagnosticos: Symptoms: progressive exertional dyspnea, fatigue, syncope
Echocardiography: estimated PASP >35-40 mmHg, right ventricular dilation
Right heart catheterization: mPAP ≥25 mmHg (definitive diagnosis)
Elevated BNP/NT-proBNP

quickView.definicao: Spectrum of acute myocardial ischemia including unstable angina, non-ST-elevation myocardial infarction (NSTEMI), and ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI). Represents a cardiovascular emergency requiring immediate intervention.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Typical chest pain: oppressive, retrosternal, radiating to the left arm/jaw, >20min
Dyspnea, cold sweat, nausea, syncope
ECG: ST-segment elevation ≥1mm in 2 contiguous leads (STEMI)
ECG: ST-segment depression, T-wave inversion (NSTEMI)
Elevated troponin (ascending curve)
HEART score ≥4 points indicates high risk

naoFarmacologico: MONABCH: Monitor, Oxygen (if SatO2<90%), Venous access
farmacologico: Sublingual nitrate (do not use if SBP<90, use of sildenafil, right ventricular AMI)

examesIniciais: Complete blood count, renal function, electrolytes

epidemiologia.prevalencia: Leading cause of death in Brazil
epidemiologia.mortalidade: 30% in the acute phase without adequate treatment
epidemiologia.faixaEtaria: Progressively increases with age, peak >60 years

fisiopatologia.texto: Rupture or erosion of a vulnerable atherosclerotic plaque, exposing the lipid core and leading to thrombus formation. In STEMI, there is complete occlusion; in NSTEMI/unstable angina, partial occlusion or microembolization.

sintomasPrincipais: Radiation to the left arm, jaw, epigastrium, back
formasClinicas: NSTEMI: elevated troponin, no ST-segment elevation

tratamento.duracao: Hospitalization + dual antiplatelet therapy for 12 months

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: First follow-up visit 7-14 days post-discharge, then monthly for 3 months

quickView.definicao: Sudden accumulation of fluid in the pulmonary interstitium and alveoli due to increased pulmonary capillary pressure (cardiogenic) or increased permeability (non-cardiogenic). Emergency with acute respiratory failure.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Intense dyspnea of sudden onset
Orthopnea (cannot lie down)
Diffuse crackles bilaterally
Pink frothy sputum (severe cases)
Tachypnea, use of accessory muscles
Chest X-ray: bilateral "bat wing" infiltrates
Elevated BNP/NT-proBNP (cardiogenic)

naoFarmacologico: LEMON: Lasix, Elevate head, Morphine, Oxygen, Nitrate
Head of bed elevated to 90° (or sitting with legs dangling)
farmacologico: Repeat if necessary; double dose if prior diuretic use

metasTerapeuticas: Identification and treatment of the cause
redFlags: No response to NIV in 30-60 min

epidemiologia.prevalencia: Common complication of HF (1 million hospitalizations/year in the USA)

fisiopatologia.texto: Increased left ventricular filling pressure → increased pulmonary capillary pressure → transudation of fluid into the interstitium and alveoli → impaired gas exchange and hypoxemia. In non-cardiogenic, there is alveolar-capillary barrier injury.

examesLaboratoriais: Complete blood count, renal function, electrolytes

tratamento.duracao: Acute phase: hours to days; chronic optimization of HF

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Continuous re-evaluation in the emergency department; cardiological follow-up
metasTerapeuticas: Optimization of ACEI/ARB, BB, mineralocorticoid antagonist
criteriosEncaminhamento: ICU if shock, intubation, or refractory
Cardiac surgery if severe valvular disease
